question: When growing up I was a competitive swimmer, waterpolo-player, surfer and lifeguard.
answer:
QUESTION
Salaams.
When growing up I was a competitive swimmer, waterpolo-player, surfer and lifeguard. When the fast came around I would not discontinue these activities even though alot of my friends regarded swimming as being garaam while fasting. I always thought i am not going to swim with the intention of drinking the water and thus swimming was not garaam. Many of them often asked what about the water entering yourt nose and ears? i would like to know ss it permissible to swim, surf , play waterpolo while fasting?

ANSWER


Share:

Assalamu Alaikum Warahmatullah

 

Brother/Sister in Islam

 

Swimming does not invalidate the fast on condition you don swallow the water. Water entering the nose and ears do not invalidate the fast.

 

 

And Allah Knows Best

 

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
